paper_metadata.title: Impact of Productive Safety Net Programs (PSNPs) on beneficiary livelihoods

program_information.program_name_citation: Productive Safety Net Programs (PSNPs) have emerged as crucial social protection measures in numerous low-income countries, with Ethiopia being a prominent example
program_information.country_citation: Productive Safety Net Programs (PSNPs) have emerged as crucial social protection measures in numerous low-income countries, with Ethiopia being a prominent example
program_information.target_population_citation: These initiatives are designed to mitigate poverty, food insecurity, and vulnerability by offering a combination of cash and food transfers, alongside public works opportunities, to households in dire need

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: These initiatives are designed to mitigate poverty, food insecurity, and vulnerability by offering a combination of cash and food transfers, alongside public works opportunities, to households in dire need

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: This study aims to investigate the impact of PSNP on the livelihood of beneficiaries based on indicators including access to basic services, income, expenditure on food, adaptive capacity, and dietary diversity
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This article used quasi-experimental design and treatment effects model
